FT.com published an article on June 30, 2013.  

The article is available at www.ft.com/cms/s/0/8466bd90-e007-11e2-9de6-00144feab7de.html#axzz2ZtQp4H13.  

Roland Huntford wrote "The Last Place on Earth."  

This book covers Scott and Amundsen's race to the South Pole.  

It was published by Modern Library in New York in 1999.  

Jim Collins and Morten T. Hansen wrote "Great by Choice."  

This book discusses uncertainty, chaos, and luck.  

It explains why some thrive despite these challenges.  

Harper Business published it in New York in 2011.  

Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky wrote about intuitive prediction.  

Their work includes biases and corrective procedures.  

It appeared in TIMS Studies in Management Science, volume 12, in 1979.  

Roger Buehler, Dale Griffin, and Michael Ross explored the "planning fallacy."  

They examined why people underestimate task completion times.  

Their study was published in the Journal of Personality and Social Psychology.  

It appeared in volume 67, issue 3, in 1994.  

The DOI for this study is 10.1037/0022-3514.67.3.366.  

Buehler, Griffin, and Ross also discussed the causes of the planning fallacy.  

Their work appears in "Heuristics and Biases: The Psychology of Intuitive Judgment."  

This book is edited by Thomas Gilovich, Dale Griffin, and Daniel Kahneman.  

It was published by Cambridge University Press in 2002.  

Stephanie P. Pezzo, Mark V. Pezzo, and Eric R. Stone studied social implications of planning.  

Their research explains how public predictions bias future plans.  

It appeared in the Journal of Experimental Social Psychology, volume 42, in 2006.  

The Global Facility for Disaster Reduction and Recovery published a report.  

It discusses protecting Morocco through integrated risk management.  

The report is available at www.gfdrr.org/sites/gfdrr.org/files/Pillar_1_Protecting_Morocco_through_Integrated_and_Comprehensive_Risk_Management.pdf.  

It was accessed on September 22, 2013.  

This piece identifies twelve reasons people don't practice risk mitigation.  

The Wharton Center for Risk Management and Decision Processes published a brief.  

It discusses informed decisions on catastrophe risk.  

This brief appeared in the Wharton Issue Brief in Winter 2010.  

It can be found at http://opim.wharton.upenn.edu/risk/library/WRCib20101_PsychNatHaz.pdf.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The page lists various references and sources related to planning, decision-making, and risk management.
